A series of laboratory exercises serve to complement the lecture material. The student may elect to complete a project for this course as part of the Comprehensive Assessment.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.29</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">101-BZP-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Environmental Biology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>12001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brian Mader</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course focuses on the basic principles of environmental biology, ecology, and the role that humans have played in changing the natural environment. Students will understand and appreciate the importance of biodiversity and the natural forces that generate and maintain the range of life on our planet.  Some of the major threats to biodiversity will be explored, such as extinction, habitat destruction, overexploitation, invasive species and climate change. The course concludes with conservation and sustainable practices. Students in the Environmental Profile will also have to complete the Independent Study in Science component of the Comprehensive Examination in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This is a Learning Communities section. Students registering for this section MUST ALSO TAKE 109-103-MQ 12001.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Off Campus Location</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">101-NYA-05</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">General Biology I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">12 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jeffrey K. L. Eng</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn to recognize the characteristics of life and how evolution gave rise to the great diversity of life forms. The relationship between biological structures and their function will be examined. How cell activities are organized and controlled, as well as cell reproduction and basic genetic principles, will be studied. The structure of ecosystems and the flow of chemicals through the environment will be examined. This course will require students to complete an independent scientific research project, to acquire and analyze data using computerized systems, and to communicate effectively using electronic media. This research project is a compulsory component of the Comprehensive Activity.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.18</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Richard Calv</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn to recognize the characteristics of life and how evolution gave rise to the great diversity of life forms. The relationship between biological structures and their function will be examined. How cell activities are organized and controlled, as well as cell reproduction and basic genetic principles, will be studied. The structure of ecosystems and the flow of chemicals through the environment will be examined. This course will require students to complete an independent scientific research project, to acquire and analyze data using computerized systems, and to communicate effectively using electronic media. This research project is a compulsory component of the Comprehensive Activity.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.18</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Richard Calv</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn to recognize the characteristics of life and how evolution gave rise to the great diversity of life forms. The relationship between biological structures and their function will be examined. How cell activities are organized and controlled, as well as cell reproduction and basic genetic principles, will be studied. The structure of ecosystems and the flow of chemicals through the environment will be examined. This course will require students to complete an independent scientific research project, to acquire and analyze data using computerized systems, and to communicate effectively using electronic media. This research project is a compulsory component of the Comprehensive Activity.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.18</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00004</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gina Gentile</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn to recognize the characteristics of life and how evolution gave rise to the great diversity of life forms. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-113-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Quality Assurance for Clinical Laboratories</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Heleni Siandris</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The objective of this course is for students to develop skills in performing activities related to quality assurance in the context of the pre-analytical, analytical, and post-analytical phases of laboratory services. Students learn basic statistical principles used in validating laboratory results through internal quality control programs. Emphasis is placed on the interpretation of quality control results and corrective action. Students train directly on computers in processing quality control data. As well principles of Quality Assurance (in particular, Quality Systems Essentials), continuous quality improvement and risk management are discussed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3G.2</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Heleni Siandris</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The objective of this course is for students to develop skills in performing activities related to quality assurance in the context of the pre-analytical, analytical, and post-analytical phases of laboratory services. Students learn basic statistical principles used in validating laboratory results through internal quality control programs. Emphasis is placed on the interpretation of quality control results and corrective action. Students train directly on computers in processing quality control data. As well principles of Quality Assurance (in particular, Quality Systems Essentials), continuous quality improvement and risk management are discussed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3G.2</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-114-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Laboratory Principles and Introduction to Hematology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Luigi Bruno, Vincenza C. Pascale</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">As an introduction into the profession, students will learn about the different responsibilities, the necessary professional attitudes, behaviors, and skills needed for success. As part of the pre-analytical phase of laboratory testing, there will be an overview of the types of testing that are performed in clinical labs. Students are introduced to phlebotomy and capillary finger puncture. In addition, topics will include transport, reception and preparation for analysis of different types of specimens.  Common errors in the pre-analytical phase including sample quality and suitability which could affect laboratory results will be discussed. As an example of the analytical phase, an introduction to hematological assays will expose students to preparing blood smears, blood cell identification and counting, including proper use of the brightfield microscope. Specimen storage and disposal as well as reporting of results are elements of the post-analytical phase and will also be covered.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.45</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.45</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:30 AM - 1:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Luigi Bruno, Vincenza C. Pascale</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">As an introduction into the profession, students will learn about the different responsibilities, the necessary professional attitudes, behaviors, and skills needed for success. As part of the pre-analytical phase of laboratory testing, there will be an overview of the types of testing that are performed in clinical labs. Students are introduced to phlebotomy and capillary finger puncture. In addition, topics will include transport, reception and preparation for analysis of different types of specimens.  Common errors in the pre-analytical phase including sample quality and suitability which could affect laboratory results will be discussed. As an example of the analytical phase, an introduction to hematological assays will expose students to preparing blood smears, blood cell identification and counting, including proper use of the brightfield microscope. Specimen storage and disposal as well as reporting of results are elements of the post-analytical phase and will also be covered.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.45</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.45</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-115-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Basic Techniques and Instrumentation</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Hannah Heath-Engel</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course students are introduced to basic laboratory skills, and to common laboratory equipment and instrumentation. Safe work practices are introduced, including universal precautions, responsible handling and storage of chemical and biological substances, and appropriate emergency response procedures. Students will learn to prepare solutions and dilutions, and to perform common laboratory calculations. Students will also be introduced to the use, maintenance and troubleshooting of common laboratory equipment and instrumentation.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.4</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Hannah Heath-Engel</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course students are introduced to basic laboratory skills, and to common laboratory equipment and instrumentation. Safe work practices are introduced, including universal precautions, responsible handling and storage of chemical and biological substances, and appropriate emergency response procedures. Students will learn to prepare solutions and dilutions, and to perform common laboratory calculations. Students will also be introduced to the use, maintenance and troubleshooting of common laboratory equipment and instrumentation.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.4</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-311-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Microorganisms and Disease 2</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Luigi Bruno</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The competencies introduced in Microorganisms and Disease 1 are reinforced and new bacterial families are introduced. The student will become efficient at identifying bacteria using appropriate staining, macroscopic and microscopic observations as well biochemical and serological testing. The students will be introduced to biosafety level 3 bacterial species such as Mycobacterium tuberculosis during the theoretical portion of the course. Basic concepts in virology will also be introduced. The emergence of antibiotic resistance will be examined and methodologies for antibiotic susceptibility testing and follow up testing for resistant strains will be carried out in the laboratory.  Students will update and maintain their Standardized Operating and Procedures manual which will serve to complement their laboratory manual in subsequent microbiology courses.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">9:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:30 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.4</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Luigi Bruno</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The competencies introduced in Microorganisms and Disease 1 are reinforced and new bacterial families are introduced. Pascale</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students study the mechanism of blood coagulation and associated disorders. Students learn skills associated with manual and automated techniques used for detecting the components of blood coagulation (hemostasis). Results are validated, recorded, reported, and monitored, and quality control standards are applied. Correct interpretation of normal and abnormal results plays an important role. The application of hemostasis case studies further students understanding of the discipline.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.15</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenza C. Students will learn about the biochemistry, physiological roles and clinical significance of each substance, and about methods used for determination in biological fluids. Emphasis is placed on: principles of sample and reagent preparation, handling and storage; appropriate instrument preparation, use, and maintenance; calibration and quality control; accuracy and precision of results; turn around time; recording and interpretation of results; potential interferences; follow-up testing; troubleshooting.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4G.2A</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Hannah Heath-Engel</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course students will continue to develop their skills in the clinical chemistry laboratory, through the performance and interpretation of assays for liver function/integrity, bilirubin and its metabolites, porphyrins/porphyrin precursors, electrolytes and body water, and acid-base balance and blood gases. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-531-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Transfusion Practices 2</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Heleni Siandris</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students continue to develop expertise in transfusion practices by learning the management of labile blood products in terms of their storage requirements, preparation and administration and therapeutic uses. Laboratory exercises focus on basic pre-transfusion testing and determining donor compatibility in cases with clinically significant antibodies.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED: August 18 to November 11, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Friday, September 2, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.15</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-541-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Professional Practice in the Healthcare</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Daniel P. Vescio</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students will research information in the field of medical laboratory science and will prepare a written project and short oral presentation based on their research topic. In preparation for their entry into the professional environment, students will learn to use effective communication and interpersonal skills in order to promote a professional organizational culture at the work place. Additionally, the application of human resource skills, problem solving skills and critical thinking skills to resolve workplace challenges and situations will be emphasized. Students will gain an in depth understanding of the laboratorys role and its impact within our healthcare system. At the end the student will exhibit professional attitudes and ethical behavior consistent with standards of practice of the profession.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED: August 18 to November 11, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Friday, September 2, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.6</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">140-551-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Core Lab</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Daniel P. Vescio, Vincenza C. Pascale</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Many hospitals have a core laboratory, where clinical testing in Biochemistry, Hematology and Hemostasis are incorporated in the same work area. In this course, students learn to process, distribute, and store patient samples for different analyses in the core laboratory, and to perform all relevant diagnostic testing and follow-up for each of the core laboratorys disciplines. Students also learn to manage inventory and troubleshoot results and instruments. Emphasis is placed on how the laboratory results correlate with diseases studied in previous courses in the program. Correct interpretation of normal and abnormal results plays an important role.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED: August 18 to November 11, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Friday, September 2, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4D.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4D.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:30 AM - 1:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Daniel P. International business has undergone dramatic changes in the past decade, and the academic discipline has evolved  in response to these changes. The course aims to introduce students to the fundamentals of international trade and investment and to expose students to the complexities of the international business environment (economic,  legal, political, cultural and technological). It will also familiarize students with the influential players on the international business scene (multinational corporations, governments and international organizations) and develop an  international perspective.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section is compatible and available for International Business Studies.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4E.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4E.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kayrod Niamir</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The International Business course offers a small window to the expanded world of international business. As such, this course is a continuation of the basic accounting techniques and theories covered in Financial Accounting I. This course is a pre-requisite for Financial Accounting III, Taxation, Management Accounting and Financial Planning and Investments. It expands on Balance Sheet accounts: current assets, long-term investments, capital and intangible assets, current and long-term liabilities. The student will learn to analyze and process data in the accounting cycle, and be introduced to partnership accounting as well as advanced corporation topics. As a prerequisite, it is assumed the student has mastered the recording procedures and Financial Statement preparation covered in Financial Accounting I.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4F.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4F.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">410-362-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Finance</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vimala Naidoo</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Finance is offered to Business Management Marketing students (410.DO). This course reviews the role of financial management and the decision-making processes required to achieve the major goal of the firm: the maximization of shareholders wealth. It includes the function of leverage and utilization of financial statements for the analysis of company performance. This course is offered in the third term of the Business Management Marketing Program expanding on skills and concepts acquired in Financial Accounting I (410-362-DW ). This course is useful to anyone pursuing any type of business career as it provides the fundamental concepts and analytical skills needed to make business decisions.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vimala Naidoo</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Finance is offered to Business Management Marketing students (410.DO). As aspiring members of the business world, it is essential for students to be cognizant of how the approach to managing people impacts the organization. Understanding the challenges that a line manager faces and how to overcome them has a significant role to play not only in influencing employee satisfaction and engagement, but also in how organizational objectives are achieved in terms of productivity and client satisfaction. By examining current practices and problems encountered by line managers, students will develop fundamental knowledge and skills associated to the key functions of human resource management and supervision, while also strengthening problem solving, decision-making, and interpersonal abilities.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Helen Stavaris</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The aim of this course is to train students to become effective line managers (managers who have a direct responsibility for employees under their charge). The main theme revolves around honing analytical skills to prepare an effective and comprehensive business plan to secure the necessary funding to launch a new venture. The reasons why people are willing to become entrepreneurs will be studied. The associated risk versus the potential for a financial return is evaluated. The key attributes and skills associated with being an entrepreneur will be explored. The differences between an entrepreneurial venture and a small business will be compared. Upon completion of this course, the student will (1) develop a business idea, (2) research and analyze all aspects related to starting a business, (3) estimate market potential to provide financial projections, (4) prepare a comprehensive business plan, and (5) present the plan to a panel of investors in a simulated classroom environment.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4D.2</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">410-516-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Financial Planning</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Martin Namour</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This Personal Financial Planning course covers the competency 01HD - Participate in the Financial analysis of investments and financial projects. The overall focus of this course is to get students familiar with concepts and applications of personal financial planning and to start to use these concepts immediately upon full-time employment. After successfully completing this course students will be able to prepare and develop a personal budget, recognize the components of a will and explain the importance of a will, learn about the different types of insurance available, explain what the RRSP and TFSA programs are and how they work, analyze the considerations underlying the selection of an investment, explore the principles that underline the assumption of personal debt, develop and explain the advantages of a portfolio of preferred and common stocks and, explain taxes on purchases, property, and earnings.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Martin Namour</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This Personal Financial Planning course covers the competency 01HD - Participate in the Financial analysis of investments and financial projects. The overall focus of this course is to get students familiar with concepts and applications of personal financial planning and to start to use these concepts immediately upon full-time employment. After successfully completing this course students will be able to prepare and develop a personal budget, recognize the components of a will and explain the importance of a will, learn about the different types of insurance available, explain what the RRSP and TFSA programs are and how they work, analyze the considerations underlying the selection of an investment, explore the principles that underline the assumption of personal debt, develop and explain the advantages of a portfolio of preferred and common stocks and, explain taxes on purchases, property, and earnings.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.27</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">202-BWT-03</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Science and technology: intro to the science of chemistry</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Comic Book Chemistry</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Yann Brouillette</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This fun course is designed for non-science students who want to learn about chemistry using facts described in superheroes universe. This new course takes an in-depth look at how certain super powers, mystical machines and heroic stunts can actually be possible, and in what extent they can be explained by chemistry.  Students will be encouraged to use rational explanation to describe out-of-the-ordinary events impersonated by characters seen in comic books, graphic novels, movies, TV shows, newspapers and more. Students will learn about chemistry and science by reading graphic novels, watching movies, and following the scientific method. From Supermans Krypton, the Incredible Hulks green skin and the Jokers laughing gas to the Walking Deads zombie symptoms, correctly depicted chemistry can be extracted from extraordinary phenomenon. By discerning magic from scientific, a comic book fan can be a science enthusiast!</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Comic Book Chemistry</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Yann Brouillette</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This fun course is designed for non-science students who want to learn about chemistry using facts described in superheroes universe. This new course takes an in-depth look at how certain super powers, mystical machines and heroic stunts can actually be possible, and in what extent they can be explained by chemistry.  Students will be encouraged to use rational explanation to describe out-of-the-ordinary events impersonated by characters seen in comic books, graphic novels, movies, TV shows, newspapers and more. Students will learn about chemistry and science by reading graphic novels, watching movies, and following the scientific method. From Supermans Krypton, the Incredible Hulks green skin and the Jokers laughing gas to the Walking Deads zombie symptoms, correctly depicted chemistry can be extracted from extraordinary phenomenon. By discerning magic from scientific, a comic book fan can be a science enthusiast!</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">202-BZF-05</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Organic Chemistry I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">12 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Robert Donga</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is for pre-university Science students who plan to study life sciences, chemistry or chemical engineering at university. Topics include: the basic theories of atoms, bonding and the states of matter; a brief review of stoichiometry; and chemical vocabulary. Emphasis will be placed on the role of the periodic table in predicting properties, and on the nature of the covalent bond. Some discussion of quantum theory, hydrogen-bonding and phase changes will also be included.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Lab Tech</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Yoon-Seo Uh</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is required for all pre-university Science students. Topics include: the basic theories of atoms, bonding and the states of matter; a brief review of stoichiometry; and chemical vocabulary. Emphasis will be placed on the role of the periodic table in predicting properties, and on the nature of the covalent bond. Some discussion of quantum theory, hydrogen-bonding and phase changes will also be included.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Yoon-Seo Uh</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is required for all pre-university Science students. Topics include: the basic theories of atoms, bonding and the states of matter; a brief review of stoichiometry; and chemical vocabulary. Emphasis will be placed on the role of the periodic table in predicting properties, and on the nature of the covalent bond. Some discussion of quantum theory, hydrogen-bonding and phase changes will also be included.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00004</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Robert Donga</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is required for all pre-university Science students. Topics include: the basic theories of atoms, bonding and the states of matter; a brief review of stoichiometry; and chemical vocabulary. Emphasis will be placed on the role of the periodic table in predicting properties, and on the nature of the covalent bond. Some discussion of quantum theory, hydrogen-bonding and phase changes will also be included.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.12</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.12</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00020</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Luc Lapierre</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is required for all pre-university Science students.             <div class="new dc_accordion open disciplineText  "><h2 class="dc_accordion-title highlighta"><a class="" style="" href="#important-information">Important Information</a></h2><div class="dc_accordion-body " style=""><p>Please note the prerequisites for each course. Students in doubt of their level must contact the department chairperson at local 4633 or e-mail hkaranika@dawsoncollege.qc.ca before registration.</p></div></div><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">613-111-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Chinese 1</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joy Cheng Yu Lin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed for students who have no prior knowledge of Chinese (Mandarin), formal or informal. The course will develop four basic language skills: speaking, writing, listening comprehension, and reading comprehension. It will focus on basic grammatical structures and vocabulary, controlled and spontaneous expression, oral/written assignments, and an introduction to culture. Language learning will be enhanced through the use of various audiovisual media, as well as additional learning activities in the language lab. In this course, students will learn the Pinyin phonetic system as well as Chinese characters.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">All Arts, Literature and Communication Profiles</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joy Cheng Yu Lin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed for students who have no prior knowledge of Chinese (Mandarin), formal or informal. The course will develop four basic language skills: speaking, writing, listening comprehension, and reading comprehension. It will focus on basic grammatical structures and vocabulary, controlled and spontaneous expression, oral/written assignments, and an introduction to culture. Language learning will be enhanced through the use of various audiovisual media, as well as additional learning activities in the language lab. Among other topics, it considers the impact of various media including oral culture, print, cinema, radio, TV, digital media, and the Internet. Essential elements of fields of cinema and communications will be presented and explained.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Cinema-Communications</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kim Simard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Explorations in Cinema and Communications is an introductory level course that provides students with a broad, basic understanding of old and new forms of media through engagement with diverse communications practices. This workshop-based course aims to equip the student with a solid critical and analytical approach to refining texts. Students may produce an original concept and story idea that may include narrative, documentary, interactive and other forms of media-related, journalistic and academic writing. The focus will be on a sharing process that includes regular analysis, critical evaluation and cultivation of student work.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Cinema-Communications</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4C.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Michael Filtz</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The goal of the Writing Lab is to advance writing skills, in a creative and conceptual sense, as well as a formal one. It also presents an overview of critical theories that have influenced filmmakers, critics, and spectators, over time. Lectures, group discussions and screenings comprise the content, while assignments include research and creative projects.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, and Cinema-Communications<br>This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">530-315-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Communication Theory</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Justine McLellan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Seeing that communication is an intricate and crucial process fundamental to life, this course examines different approaches to its study.  Many important questions are explored.  Does language and writing make humans unique? Are images or words more powerful?  Can our thoughts and emotions be expressed as algorithms and will artificial intelligence make humans irrelevant? Do social media connect or isolate us? Will digital media and the Internet transform all forms of work and careers? These are issues critical for society.  Communication technologies and research are at centre of it all.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, and Cinema-Communications</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">530-413-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Media Lab</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Justine McLellan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">A course designed to introduce students to the processes involved in planning, designing, and delivering interactive and multi-media projects and events. Cinema and Culture provides an overview of the diverse cultural responses to film.  Through exposure to a range of media, from historical to contemporary, including foreign and independent films, students will learn how to contextualize and interpret the social and cultural values expressed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts<br>This section will be offered partially on-line.
