The laboratory experiments are designed to deepen the students understanding of the overall procedure of chemical analysis from interpreting the analysis protocol to performing the analysis and interpreting the results.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:30 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">210-512-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Electrochemistry</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Daniel Baril</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course provides the competencies associated to the field of electrochemical analysis. A review and application of the different potentiometric and galvanometric electrochemical techniques will be covered. The student will be familiarized with the construction and the use of different working (indicator) and reference electrode and the assembly of electrochemical cells for performing electroanalytical measurements.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">210-531-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Organic Analysis</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Roger Machaalani</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The Organic Analysis Course covers all aspects of the reactions, preparation and spectroscopic analysis of organic molecules and mixtures. The emphasis is on the techniques commonly used in industry, such as thin-layer chromatography (TLC), column and flash chromatography, capillary electrophoresis, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), infrared (IR) and mass spectroscopy (MS).</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">210-551-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Physicochemical Measurements</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Omar Behar</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and concepts of Chemical Thermodynamics and their applications to problems of chemical interests.  Physical Chemistry provides future chemical technologists with the theoretical background necessary for comprehension of important industrial processes and for further study. The laboratory experiments will acquaint students with basic apparatus and experimental techniques used in Physical Chemistry.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.5</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Omar Behar</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and concepts of Chemical Thermodynamics and their applications to problems of chemical interests. Soltuz</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The purpose of this course is to make the student think, specifically in the area of mathematical problems arising from current procedures in civil engineering; e.g. surveying, estimating, CAD, and design in general. Students will be introduced to the variety of technocultural factors that gave rise to interactive media, and has brought the field to where it is today. Through the unifying lens of creativity, students will also develop a deeper understanding of the diversity of current interactive media forms and practices, as well as their social and cultural ramifications. These forms could include interactive sculptures, responsive objects and environments, apps, interactive narratives, games, visualizations and modelling, cyberart, and interactive sound, music and video art.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brengre Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the field of interactive media arts, from its earliest influences to its present state. Students will be introduced to the variety of technocultural factors that gave rise to interactive media, and has brought the field to where it is today. Through the unifying lens of creativity, students will also develop a deeper understanding of the diversity of current interactive media forms and practices, as well as their social and cultural ramifications. These forms could include interactive sculptures, responsive objects and environments, apps, interactive narratives, games, visualizations and modelling, cyberart, and interactive sound, music and video art.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-312-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">The Interactive Experience</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brengre Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course provides frameworks for understanding the general meaning, aesthetic intent, function or purpose of interactive works. There are numerous ways in which works of art and design can be understood to be interactive: as responsive objects, as closed circuit environments, as systems, and as participatory situations, among others. This course will introduce and apply a variety of models and perspectives that will further develop students understanding of interactive media.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-313-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Interactive Media Workshop</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">John Connolly</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed to deepen students understanding of the language of interaction and interactive media, and to provide a context within which they can develop a more profound appreciation for the creative possibilities associated with these rich, rapidly evolving forms of expression. By examining and analyzing the works of others, and by conceiving, designing, creating and documenting their own individual and group interactive projects, students move themselves towards a greater fluidity with the creative possibilities of these forms of media. Works could involve interactive sculptures, installations, music or sound-based projects, toys, performances, games, and narratives, among others.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, and Interactive Media Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-912-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Exploring Creativity</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Daniel Freder</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Creativity plays an important role in every field of human endeavour: from the arts, to science, to politics and commerce, and in the choices and challenges of everyday life. It also has ramifications at the societal and global levels; participating meaningfully in an increasingly complex, evolving and uncertain world requires creativity.  This course is designed to provide students with an overview of the models, tools, techniques, roles, and applications of creativity, including both traditional and technologically mediated forms of art and design. In addition, students will be encouraged to develop their own, personalized understanding of the definitions, nature and applications of creativity.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Anna Eyler</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Creativity plays an important role in every field of human endeavour: from the arts, to science, to politics and commerce, and in the choices and challenges of everyday life. It also has ramifications at the societal and global levels; participating meaningfully in an increasingly complex, evolving and uncertain world requires creativity.  This course is designed to provide students with an overview of the models, tools, techniques, roles, and applications of creativity, including both traditional and technologically mediated forms of art and design. In addition, students will be encouraged to develop their own, personalized understanding of the definitions, nature and applications of creativity.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-913-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">The Networked World</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brengre Marin Dubuard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Networks have become the dominant metaphor of the 21st century. This course gives students an introduction to the art, science and theory of networks, examines a diverse range of technocultural products and practices, and explores their ramifications in the virtual, sociocultural, and physical worlds.   Among other topics, this course will examine how different societies develop original forms of expression using technological tools, such as the World Wide Web. For example, how Hacktivism, new forms of Networked Art, and alternate models of audience participation and engagement such as social media, tactical media and pervasive games have emerged. Other current themes like high frequency trading, global security and surveillance programs, and crypto currencies may be presented, as well as related works by artists and designers from various cultural backgrounds.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-916-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Game Making</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Shawn Bell</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Games integrate many forms of research and mediaincluding game design, narrative design, level design, artwork, animation, cinema, sound design, voice acting, music, acting, psychology, history, politics, economics, etc. into immersive, interactive experiences. In Game Making, students will be introduced to a game engine and development tools, form teams and plan and build a prototype of a game based on selected game and level design documents.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">585-923-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Tangible Media: Making Things Interactive</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">John Connolly</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this playful and engaging course, students design simple interactive objects and explore their expressive potential. This is a hands-on, project-based workshop that sits at the intersection of art, crafts, design, and interactive technology. Students experiment with recyclable materials such as paper, wood, cardboard, or found objects like toys, and are introduced to some basic principles of mechanics, simple electronics, and ready-to-use interactive technologies like LittleBits. The course allows non-technical students to discover the creative potential of sculptural physical objects using various forms of interactivity. The functioning of some familiar objects (a child's mechanical toy, for example) is demystified and leveraged towards creative expression, prototyping and speculative design. No previous experience is required for this course; it is intended for a non-technical audience.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Medical Ultrasound Technology</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U11-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Medical Ultrasound - Fundamentals of the Profession</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford, Gaelle Bambi Mpiana</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to recognize the professional implications, the legal issues and their role within the framework of the medical ultrasound profession. Students will also reflect on their personal career choice and familiarize themselves with the structure of the medical ultrasound technology program. Students will learn to identify legislative requirements of federal and provincial laws that govern the profession of ultrasound technologists. Furthermore, students will examine the skills and behaviours related to the role of their profession while exploring their function within a multidisciplinary team. Finally, the student will understand their responsibilities as future medical ultrasound technologists and the expectations of the job market.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford, Gaelle Bambi Mpiana</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to recognize the professional implications, the legal issues and their role within the framework of the medical ultrasound profession. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U12-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Patient Care, Health and Safety</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Eleni Joannides</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on course, students learn about safety, hygiene, effective measures for infection control and emergency protocols. Students will also begin learning the fundamental skills of patient management and the importance of communication within the ultrasound profession. Students will apply the governing regulations to the overall health of patients and healthcare professionals. Students will learn to recognize the risks and dangers associated with the professional practice. Finally, students will apply ergonomic work methods and learn relevant clinical terminology. This course will prime students for the Patient Care and Pharmacology course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.18</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Eleni Joannides</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on course, students learn about safety, hygiene, effective measures for infection control and emergency protocols. Students will learn to integrate the theoretical knowledge learned in physics of ultrasound and apply it to the machine to enhance and improve their ultrasound images. Students will explore elements of a quality assurance program and will introduce general quality control practices. Finally, they will archive data and be introduced to various diagnostic imaging modalities. This course will prime students for the Instrumentation and Quality Control course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.34</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kieran David Bradshaw</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This interactive course introduces students to instrumentation principles and various modes of acquisition while ensuring patient safety. Students will explore elements of a quality assurance program and will introduce general quality control practices. Finally, they will archive data and be introduced to various diagnostic imaging modalities. This course will prime students for the Instrumentation and Quality Control course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.08</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.34</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-U31-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Obstetrical and Gynecological Ultrasound I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on scanning course, students will learn how to plan for a Trimester 1 and 2 Obstetrical examination as well as a Gynecological examination.  Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care and instrumentation, students will learn to effectively acquire the proper diagnostic images and data while utilizing effective scanning techniques.  They will incorporate their anatomy and physiology knowledge to analyze images and identify basic pathologies. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during an Obstetrical and Gynecological examination. This course will prime students for the further application of these principles and procedures in Obstetrical and Gynecological Ultrasound 2.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on scanning course, students will learn how to plan for a Trimester 1 and 2 Obstetrical examination as well as a Gynecological examination.  Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care and instrumentation, students will learn to effectively acquire the proper diagnostic images and data while utilizing effective scanning techniques.  They will incorporate their anatomy and physiology knowledge to analyze images and identify basic pathologies. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during an Obstetrical and Gynecological examination. This course will prime students for the further application of these principles and procedures in Obstetrical and Gynecological Ultrasound 2.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cassandra Mofford</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this hands-on scanning course, students will learn how to plan for a Trimester 1 and 2 Obstetrical examination as well as a Gynecological examination.  Applying knowledge developed in anatomy, physiology, patient care and instrumentation, students will learn to effectively acquire the proper diagnostic images and data while utilizing effective scanning techniques.  They will incorporate their anatomy and physiology knowledge to analyze images and identify basic pathologies. Also, they will begin to acquire the skills to describe, transmit and record important findings during an Obstetrical and Gynecological examination. This course will prime students for the further application of these principles and procedures in Obstetrical and Gynecological Ultrasound 2.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.10</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.30</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.32</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; <p>Daily practice is highly recommended in order to acquire the competencies necessary to be successful in the course.</p></div></div><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-302-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Music History</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is an introduction to the aesthetics of art music. Students will explore a variety of aesthetic theories as well as the principal composers, genres, and style periods of Western art and music.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Sarah Rossy</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is an introduction to the aesthetics of art music. Students will explore a variety of aesthetic theories as well as the principal composers, genres, and style periods of Western art and music.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-901-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Appreciating Music</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will help students to develop their aesthetic creative & critical listening skills. It will introduce students to the concepts and terminology required to understand and appreciate music. Through the works of outstanding artists, students will be exposed to a diversity of musical styles and genres. Students will also learn how to listen perceptively to the techniques composers use to achieve their artistic goals.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Sarah Rossy</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will help students to develop their aesthetic creative & critical listening skills. It will introduce students to the concepts and terminology required to understand and appreciate music. Through the works of outstanding artists, students will be exposed to a diversity of musical styles and genres. Students will also learn how to listen perceptively to the techniques composers use to achieve their artistic goals.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-903-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Popular Music Culture</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vincenzo Lentini</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is an introduction to a diversity of popular styles that flourished after 1945 in the US, Canada and the UK. Students will explore leading styles, major artists and groups, and significant song themes. Emphasis will be given to rock and roll which, in the mid-1950's, revolutionized popular music and has become its predominant expression.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">550-921-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Singing</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jacinta Luis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to the basic principles of singing and vocal techniques. 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.16</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">8A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Nursing</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-111-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Nursing</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">6 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Charlie Myriam Julien, Jian Ning Li, Lucien Chiasson, Magdalena Mlek, Rhizlane Bougrine, Sabrina Zaman, Sherry McMillan, Stefanie Irrgang, Youngnam Hwang</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this first nursing course, the student will be introduced to the role and nature of the nursing profession. Students will learn about the history of the nursing profession, and the values, ethics, and legislation that affect nursing practice in Quebec. They will gain a fundamental understanding of the nursing meta paradigm and the nursing conceptual framework upon which the nursing program is based. The students will also learn some basic nursing skills and procedures in the laboratory and the clinical setting, including vital signs, hygiene care, infection control, body mechanics, the fundamentals of medication administration, and the use of therapeutic communication.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Wednesday, November 9 is ONLINE.<br>HOSPITAL HOURS INCLUDE DAYS/EVENINGS<br>Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-323-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Medical/Surgical Nursing Fall</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Genevive McCaughey, Giovanna Primerano, Lauren Elisabeth Haughton, Natalie Turner, Patricia Bondu, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this Nursing course, students will integrate the knowledge and abilities learned in previous program-specific courses to care for adult medical/surgical patients with complex health problems. The Dawson College Nursing Model discussed in previous nursing courses will now be used in the planning and implementation of nursing care. Complex disease processes that affect multiple body systems (i.e. Diabetes Mellitus), chronic illness (i.e. Cirrhosis, Crohns Disease and Neoplasms) and concepts of Loss and Grief as it relates to chronicity will be explored. In the clinical area the student will have ample opportunity to elaborate on and apply the principles of surgical asepsis such as urinary catheterizations, tracheostomy and ostomy care and care of complex wounds and dressings.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">STAGE INCLUDES DAYS/EVENINGS AND WEEK-ENDS</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-333-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Maternal/Child Health Nursing Fall</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Atif Abbas, Devin Katrina Smith, Marie-Christine Borruel, Meggie Carpel, Natalie Morin, Shafiqa Awj Allahyar, Sherry McMillan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will provide the student with an understanding of Nursing concepts related to birth, first year of life, early childhood, adolescence, parental relationship (pregnancy, labour, childbirth nursing, post-natal follow-up, the familys needs and care, child/parents interactions). With the help of the Nursing Model used at Dawson College a strong emphasis will be placed on understanding the needs of caregivers and patients alike. The promotion and maintenance of optimal health is one of the highlights of this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">STAGE INCLUDES DAYS/EVENINGS AND WEEK-ENDS</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Hospital</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-341-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Genevive McCaughey, Giovanna Primerano, Natalie Turner, Patricia Bondu, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In the Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness I course, students will explore the use of nutrition and medications to optimize health. Nutritional and pharmacological support during recovery from surgery and illness and in the management of chronic diseases will also be discussed. In the first part of the course, students will examine nutritional requirements over the lifespan and discuss how age-related physiological changes impact both nutritional requirements and the pharmacokinetics of medications. Nutritional and pharmacological challenges specific to certain developmental stages will also be discussed. In the second part of the course, the role of nutrition and medications in illness prevention and treatment of chronic diseases such as diabetes and heart disease will be examined. The nurses role in patient education regarding safe medication  administration at home and ensuring patient adherence to nutritional and medication  therapy will also be discussed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Genevive McCaughey, Giovanna Primerano, Natalie Turner, Patricia Bondu, Yvette Marks</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In the Collaborative Therapies in Health and Illness I course, students will explore the use of nutrition and medications to optimize health. Nutritional and pharmacological support during recovery from surgery and illness and in the management of chronic diseases will also be discussed. In the first part of the course, students will examine nutritional requirements over the lifespan and discuss how age-related physiological changes impact both nutritional requirements and the pharmacokinetics of medications. Nutritional and pharmacological challenges specific to certain developmental stages will also be discussed. In the second part of the course, the role of nutrition and medications in illness prevention and treatment of chronic diseases such as diabetes and heart disease will be examined. The nurses role in patient education regarding safe medication  administration at home and ensuring patient adherence to nutritional and medication  therapy will also be discussed.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">180-516-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Promoting Autonomy</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Alfi Riffat Mahbub, Debra Goldstein, Helen Vaupshas, Jocelyne Blondeau, Khaleda Begum, Melanie Zseder, Sarah Bolivar, Sarah Robertson, Uliana Grebenuk Roy, Yael Hoffman</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course the student will explore the concept of Autonomy following patients in one rotation in psychiatry and one rotation in gerontology in acute, long term, rehabilitation or palliative settings. Aided by the Dawson College Nursing Model and integrating previous knowledge from Nursing, Health Assessment, Biology, Nutrition, Pharmacology and Human Development, the student will identify areas of loss of Autonomy and plan appropriate interventions to compensate for these losses.      ?</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">PLUS INTENSIVE<br>STAGE HOURS INCLUDE DAYS AND EVENINGS</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 16, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Dec 09, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">6B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Philosophy</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-101-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Philosophy</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">5 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jessica Lim</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. In a broad sense, this course explores the human condition, and the ways we humans have tried to understand and define ourselves, our world and our possibilities. As this is an introductory course, students will also learn and practice the philosophical fundamentals of sound argumentation. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.21</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.21</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered.
