By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.26</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. In a broad sense, this course explores the human condition, and the ways we humans have tried to understand and define ourselves, our world and our possibilities. As this is an introductory course, students will also learn and practice the philosophical fundamentals of sound argumentation. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.22</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.22</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00004</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. In a broad sense, this course explores the human condition, and the ways we humans have tried to understand and define ourselves, our world and our possibilities. As this is an introductory course, students will also learn and practice the philosophical fundamentals of sound argumentation. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">How Can I Know Who I Am?</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>12001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brian Redekopp</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Who am I? What do I want to become? These questions can involve tremendous pressure: pressure to conform, pressure to know now what ones path is going to be, pressure to make the right moral choices in a world in peril, and the anxiety that comes with all of this. This course, which is paired with General Psychology, will explore how Philosophy and Psychology investigate the self and identity and apply these investigations to our own paths of self-discovery. The Psychology course explores current and historical perspectives in the field, the brain and its many functions, why people behave the way they do, and more. In the Philosophy course, we will explore questions such as the nature of the self (and whether there even is one), how free one is to create ones own identity, the nature of self-love and self-knowledge, the possibility of altruism, and the existential roots of anxiety.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This is a Learning Communities section. Students registering for this section  CAN TAKE IT SEPARATELY OR AS A PAIR WITH 350-101-DW 12001.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-303-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Philosophy: Thinking for Ourselves</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jessica Lim</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In a world which moves so quickly there often isnt even time to think, it is imperative to develop the skills necessary to engage in critical reflection and interpretation, to reason effectively and creatively, to separate truth from illusion, and to judge, act and communicate in ways that lead to a meaningful and authentic life. In this course, we will pursue those skills by focusing on the art of doing philosophy  studying and practicing the critical and creative reasoning that philosophical thinking demands, and which is increasingly important to a fulfilling engagement with life in a modern, fast-paced technological culture. Through our study of philosophy and the philosophical method, we will be more prepared than ever to think for ourselves, to challenge and defend ideas, to find meaning and to articulate our identities and place in the world.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture<br>This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-910-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Ancient Philosophy</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, the writings of the pre-Socratic philosophers will be studied, such as Thales, Anaximander, Empedocles, and some texts of Plato and Aristotle. The main objective is to introduce students to ancient philosophical ideas, including those of ancient science, with an eye to clarifying some of the projects and  problems of philosophy, and to understanding the similarities and differences between ancient and modern science.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Liberal Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.22</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.22</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-913-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Philosophy and Culture</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">The Philosophy of Love</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Sarah Allen</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to philosophy and its cultural role through philosophical reflection on love. Questions well consider include: What is love? (Is it a feeling? A choice? A value judgment?) What are the different kinds of love? What is the value of love? (Why love? Is it worth it?) To what extent is love universal, and to what extent does it vary from one culture to another? How has culture shaped our own ideas about love, and are these ideas true and beneficial? By thinking about such questions in light of what major thinkers have had to say about love, students will be introduced to the practice of philosophy, as well as to central philosophical figures, areas and movements.  Throughout the course we will see how philosophy critiques and contributes to the surrounding culture.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Languages, Literature, and Studio Arts<br>This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4P.25</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4D.2</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-943-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Ethics of Journalism</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Brian Redekopp</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In an age of fake news, culture wars, social media filter bubbles, infotainment, and widespread distrust in the media establishment, good journalism seems more vitally important than ever before. But what is good journalism? What standards should journalists follow in reporting news, and what should we as media consumers do to help ensure we are getting true and meaningful information? In this course well develop answers to these questions by examining key aspects of the contemporary news media. These include the essential roles journalism plays in a democratic society, what makes something  news, how news organizations get revenue, the economic and psychological forces behind misinformation and disinformation, and skills in media literacy. This course offers students a deeper understanding of the nature of good journalism as well as the knowledge and skills to be more media savvy and ethically responsible in producing and consuming news.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Arts and Culture, Cinema-Communications, Interactive Media Arts, Literature, and Studio Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5D.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">340-BWS-03</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to Philosophy</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">4 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jessica Lim</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. In a broad sense, this course explores the human condition, and the ways we humans have tried to understand and define ourselves, our world and our possibilities. As this is an introductory course, students will also learn and practice the philosophical fundamentals of sound argumentation. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.21</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.21</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gerardo Mosquera</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will survey central philosophical questions and how influential philosophers have attempted to answer them. Major topics such as the nature of reality, truth, knowledge, justice, personal identity, freedom, responsibility, and meaning will be covered. By the end of the course, students will have an understanding of basic problems of philosophy and their development. They will also have a sense of philosophys relevance and importance for the social sciences, the natural sciences, and contemporary issues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Physical Education</h2><div class="new dc_accordion open disciplineText  "><h2 class="dc_accordion-title highlighta"><a class="" style="" href="#important-information">Important Information</a></h2><div class="dc_accordion-body " style=""><p>The following courses are required Physical Education courses: 109-101-MQ, 109-102-MQ, 109-103-MQ.</p>
<p>** These courses <u>cannot </u>be used as complementary courses - no exceptions. ** For complementary Physical Education courses see the complementary section of the timetable.</p>
<p>Students with medical problems who require placement in an appropriate course must contact either Richard Montreuil (local 4753), Layal Nakhle (local 4936), or Christine Bustamante (local 1194), prior to course allocation.</p>
<p>Attendance in Physical Education classes is compulsory. Students must be dressed to participate for the first class.</p>
<p>Four hours of absence, for any reason, is the maximum allowed for Physical Education courses, except Outdoor Education where 100% attendance is required.</p>
<p>Students must complete both 109-101-MQand 109-102-MQbefore 109-103-MQ.</p>
<p>All 109-101-MQ sections are titled Physical Activity and Health"; 109-102-MQsections are titled Physical Activity and Effectiveness"; and 109-103-MQ sections are titled Physical Activity and Autonomy. Please take note of the subtitle as well as the course number when registering.</p>
<p><strong><u>Intensive Courses</u></strong><strong><br />
</strong>All intensive courses have one class scheduled prior to course change. Verify lecture time and location. All classes are compulsory.</p>
<p><strong><u>Showering and Changing Time</u></strong><br />
Students should allow  hour after scheduled classes for showering and changing.</p></div></div><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">109-101-MQ</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Physical Activity and Health</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">72 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Fitness Walking (COMPRESSED)</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Venere Di Genova</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to cardiovascular and muscular conditioning through fitness walking and is offered in a compressed format. The compressed format includes several three-hour classes during the term and two full day classes, which are located around the Montreal area, and held on separate weekends. The primary focus of the course is to examine the role that physical activity plays in the promotion of health. This course takes place off-campus. Verify facility location and dates in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering. All fees are waived until further notice.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED COURSE: TRAVEL TIME NOT INCLUDED</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Friday, September 2, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Extra Information:</label><div class="col-md-10">This section requires you to understand the policies and procedures for <a href="/intensive-compressed-and-outdoor-education-courses/">Intensive / Compressed and Outdoor Education Courses</a></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 7:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3B.15</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Urban Hiking (COMPRESSED)</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Patrick Burkhard</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to cardiovascular and muscular conditioning through hiking in urban settings and is offered in a compressed format. The primary focus of the course is to examine the role that physical activity plays in the promotion of health. The compressed format includes several three-hour classes during the term and two full day classes held on separate weekends. This course takes place off-campus. Verify facility location and dates in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering. All fees are waived until further notice.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED COURSE: TRAVEL TIME NOT INCLUDED</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Thursday, September 8, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Extra Information:</label><div class="col-md-10">This section requires you to understand the policies and procedures for <a href="/intensive-compressed-and-outdoor-education-courses/">Intensive / Compressed and Outdoor Education Courses</a></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 24, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Aug 24, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - Examples of activities include cycling, day hiking, orienteering, in-line skating, and shelter construction. Theoretical and practical sessions will provide the knowledge and skills necessary to promote health, wellness and positive lifestyle habits. All classes, training sessions, and activity days are mandatory. Students missing these sessions will be considered unprepared and may be denied permission to continue in the course. This course takes place off-campus. The primary focus of the course is to examine the role that physical activity plays in the promotion of health. All classes and intensive days are mandatory. Students missing these sessions will be considered unprepared and may be denied permission to continue in the course. This course takes place off-campus.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED COURSE: TRAVEL TIME NOT INCLUDED</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Friday, September 2, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Extra Information:</label><div class="col-md-10">This section requires you to understand the policies and procedures for <a href="/intensive-compressed-and-outdoor-education-courses/">Intensive / Compressed and Outdoor Education Courses</a></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - Verify facility location, dates and time in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">0H.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Resistance Training</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00038</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Matthew Potter</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to a variety of resistance training exercises and programs using different forms of resistance, such as medicine balls, stability balls, free weights, body weight, machines, and rubber bands. 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4F.1</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Canoe Skills (COMPRESSED)</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00008</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cindy Cantin-Starzenski</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, you will learn how to safely and effectively conduct canoe outings. Starting with an assessment of your previous experience (none is required), you will be introduced to a progressive sequence of skills and set personal goals. The ultimate aim of the class is for you to establish a personal sense of responsibility and autonomy in performing this activity. The course is offered in two formats: 1) as 3 single-day outings on local lakes, or 2) a 3-day intensive in the Laurentians. Both formats include several afternoon or evening sessions. All classes and activity sessions are mandatory. Students missing these sessions will be considered unprepared and may be denied permission to continue in the course. This course takes place off-campus. Verify dates & location in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED COURSE: TRAVEL TIME NOT INCLUDED</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Thursday, September 8, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Extra Information:</label><div class="col-md-10">This section requires you to understand the policies and procedures for <a href="/intensive-compressed-and-outdoor-education-courses/">Intensive / Compressed and Outdoor Education Courses</a></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 24, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Aug 24, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">6:00 PM - Activities include planning, assembling and sleeping in a shelter, fixing one-pot meals, experiencing basic survival skill such as orienteering and wilderness first aid. Group and individual work will be required prior to the intensive days. In addition to personal preparation for the excursion, students will be expected to use the knowledge acquired in their 101 and 102 courses to plan and carry out a personal activity program, which will contribute to their health and well-being. All classes, training sessions, and camping days are mandatory. Students missing these sessions will be considered unprepared and may be denied permission to continue in the course. This course takes place off-campus. 4:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">Arundel</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Active Living (COMPRESSED)</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00008</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cindy Cantin-Starzenski</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course will introduce students to a variety of activities that could be incorporated into their lifestyle to promote active living and wellness. Activities could include any of the following and other options depending on facilities and ideas from class members: sports, games, individual fitness exercises, walking and relaxation activities, etc. In addition to participating in class activities, students will plan and carry out an individualized fitness program outside of class time, within their own personal schedule. The compressed format includes several three-hour classes during the term and two full day classes held on separate weekends. Verify facility location in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">COMPRESSED COURSE: TRAVEL TIME NOT INCLUDED</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, August 29, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Extra Information:</label><div class="col-md-10">This section requires you to understand the policies and procedures for <a href="/intensive-compressed-and-outdoor-education-courses/">Intensive / Compressed and Outdoor Education Courses</a></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Start Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="End Date">Aug 18, 2022</td><td data-label="Time">6:00 PM - This 3-day retreat offers students the opportunity to disconnect with technology and society, and re-connect with nature and oneself. All classes and yoga sessions are mandatory. This course takes place off-campus. The course will include activities such as muscular endurance training in particular core training, flexibility training to improve range of motion and prevent injury, cardiovascular endurance training focusing on building up the students ability to run for longer and longer distances, and learning proper running techniques to produce effective runners. In addition to participating in-class activities, students will plan and carry out an individualized fitness program in order to demonstrate their ability to assume responsibility for maintaining a healthy lifestyle.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">-2H.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Sport Performance Training</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00049</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Linda Benjamin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students, who are already involved in high-performance sport or activity, to a variety of training methods designed to enhance personal performance in that sport or activity. Verify facility location, dates and time in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">-2H.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Wilderness Camping with Science (INTENSIVE)</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>12001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jonathan Egan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This intensive course introduces the student to camping in a wilderness setting. Activities include planning, assembling and sleeping in a shelter, fixing one-pot meals, experiencing basic survival skills such as orienteering and wilderness first aid. Group and individual work will be required prior to the intensive days. In addition to personal preparation for the excursion, students will be expected to use the knowledge acquired in their 101 and 102 courses to plan and carry out a personal activity program, which will contribute to their health and well-being. All classes, training sessions, and camping days are mandatory. Students missing these sessions will be considered unprepared and may be denied permission to continue in the course. This course takes place off-campus. Verify facility location, dates and time in the Timetable & Registration Guide prior to registering.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Fee</label><div class="col-md-10"> $0.00</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This is a Learning Communities section. Topics include: Sound as a wave, transducer physics, interactions with tissue, Doppler effect, ultrasound safety, and other imaging modalities. Students will learn: to connect the principles of sound waves to ultrasound signal production and detection, how the Doppler Effect is used to create Doppler ultrasound images, to connect the principles of energy absorption and attenuation to ultrasound safety. Following completion of this course, students will be prepared to take Instrumentation II.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Medical Ultrasound Tech</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.9</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">203-911-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Physics of Medical Imaging</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Michelle Baryliuk-Raimbert</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course teaches the fundamental physics underpinning diagnostic imaging. 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.37</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.9</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.37</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">203-BWT-03</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Science and technology: intro to the science of physics</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">The Physics of Hollywood</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Andrew Stewart</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This complementary course will be of interest to students with little or no background in science but who are curious about how things work and wonder if the science portrayed in the movies is correct or not. By watching movies, conducting simple experiments and following the scientific method students will learn about physics and science. Topics will include invisibility, time travel, parallel universes and more. From James Bond to Bugs Bunny, Spiderman to Jurassic Park the course is fun way to learn about the world and how it really works.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.9</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Astronomy</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Nadim Boukhira</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course focuses on the scientific method as applied to astronomy. It examines the social context of certain astronomical developments, explains basic physical principles, and applies them to questions in astronomy. Among the issues covered are modern cosmology, the search for planets around other stars, extra-terrestrial intelligence, and support for space exploration/ supercolliders. Models are used to explain/predict astronomical phenomena.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.2</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4G.2A</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Astronomy</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Rim Dib</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course focuses on the scientific method as applied to astronomy. It examines the social context of certain astronomical developments, explains basic physical principles, and applies them to questions in astronomy. Among the issues covered are modern cosmology, the search for planets around other stars, extra-terrestrial intelligence, and support for space exploration/ supercolliders. Models are used to explain/predict astronomical phenomena.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">203-BZE-05</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Engineering Physics</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Manuel Toharia Zapata</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is an option course for students in the Science Program who wish to pursue their interest in engineering and related fields. The course involves extensive use of computers in the gathering and analysis of data as well as in using spreadsheets to model a variety of different physical phenomena. The topics covered include: kinematics and dynamics of rigid body motion; fluid mechanics; structural analysis of frames, trusses and beams; statics in three dimensions; strength of materials. Students may choose to do the independent study project of the comprehensive examination in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.6</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">203-NYA-05</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Mechanics</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">13 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Michelle Baryliuk-Raimbert</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Mechanics is the first course in the physics sequence of the science program, covering the basic concepts of force, energy and momentum, and the laws governing motion. Students will be introduced to the acquisition and analysis of data by computer. Topics include: kinematics in one and two dimensions, Newton's laws, friction, work, energy and power, collisions and conservation of momentum, rotational kinematics and dynamics, torque, angular momentum and moment of inertia.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.2</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.4</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Alexandre Pronine</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Mechanics is the first course in the physics sequence of the science program, covering the basic concepts of force, energy and momentum, and the laws governing motion. Topics include: kinematics in one and two dimensions, Newton's laws, friction, work, energy and power, collisions and conservation of momentum, rotational kinematics and dynamics, torque, angular momentum and moment of inertia.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science<br>This is a Learning Communities section. Computers are used in the experimental work in this course. Topics include electrostatics, Coulomb's Law, electric field and potential, lines of force and equipotentials, Gauss's Law, capacitors and dielectrics, DC circuits, the magnetic field, the laws of Biot-Savart and Ampre, magnetic force on moving charges and currents, torque on a current loop, electromagnetic induction and Faraday's Law, inductance, energy density of electric and magnetic fields. Students may opt to do the independent study project of the comprehensive examination in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7B.6</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.9</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kibreab Mebrahtom Haile</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The third course in the physics sequence of the science program deals with electric and magnetic phenomena. It introduces oscillations, mechanical waves, optics and modern physics. Students will extend their skills in using the computer to gather data. Topics include: simple harmonic motion; damping, forced oscillations and resonance; waves in material media, including sound waves; beats and the Doppler effect; ray and wave optics; introduction to modern physics.  Students in their third or fourth semester may opt to do the independent study project of their comprehensive examination in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Enriched Science</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.6</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Nadim Boukhira</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the science program's second course in physics. It introduces oscillations, mechanical waves, optics and modern physics. Students will extend their skills in using the computer to gather data. Topics include: simple harmonic motion; damping, forced oscillations and resonance; waves in material media, including sound waves; beats and the Doppler effect; ray and wave optics; introduction to modern physics.  Students in their third or fourth semester may opt to do the independent study project of their comprehensive examination in this course.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4E.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4E.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.7</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00006</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Rim Dib</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the science program's second course in physics. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-331-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Pathophysiology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Sharon Patricia Clegg</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn about various pathological conditions such as: diabetes, immunologic conditions, cardiorespiratory conditions, skeletal, and arthritic conditions. They will learn about various tests discovered in patient files (X-ray, MRI, Bone Scan, Ultrasound, CT scan, EMG, and ECG) as well as other pertinent information such as medication lists in order to relate their findings to pathological conditions and their effects on physiotherapy treatments.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-341-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Kinesiology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Michael Pilon-Piquette</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The objective of this course is to introduce students to the fundamentals of exercise prescription. First, topics regarding the effects of physical activity and inactivity will be examined from an anatomical and physiological point of view. Then, the students will learn about the principals of exercise program design and education to a single client and/or group of people. Finally, the students will be introduced to a variety of exercise equipment which will allow them to be more versatile in the application of their exercise prescription knowledge.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Lecture every second week.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.12</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.09</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Michael Pilon-Piquette</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The objective of this course is to introduce students to the fundamentals of exercise prescription. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-354-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Intervention: Pain and Circulation</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gloria Thevasagayam</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The major goal of this course is to intervene in cases involving pain and rehabilitate clients with circulatory problems of the extremities. Upon completion of this course, students will be able to perform a subjective data collection, identify and interpret information related to pain and circulatory problems from the patients file, establish clear aims of treatment for the different stages of rehabilitation as well as create and execute rehabilitation interventions. To this end, the students will study the use and practice the application of thermal agents, massage, compression units, elastic bandages and compression socks, mechanical and manual traction, relaxation techniques and exercise prescription.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:30 PM - 3:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.16</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gloria Thevasagayam</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The major goal of this course is to intervene in cases involving pain and rehabilitate clients with circulatory problems of the extremities. Upon completion of this course, students will be able to perform a subjective data collection, identify and interpret information related to pain and circulatory problems from the patients file, establish clear aims of treatment for the different stages of rehabilitation as well as create and execute rehabilitation interventions. To this end, the students will study the use and practice the application of thermal agents, massage, compression units, elastic bandages and compression socks, mechanical and manual traction, relaxation techniques and exercise prescription.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.16</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-371-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Electrotherapy</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Maureen MacMahon</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will be introduced to the parameters of therapeutic modalities and their physiological effects. Various modalities will be examined including ultrasound, muscle stimulation, interferential current, transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation, biofeedback, and laser therapy.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.16</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Maureen MacMahon</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will be introduced to the parameters of therapeutic modalities and their physiological effects. Upon completion of this course, the student will be able to discuss the different conditions and their implications as an associated condition for someone already receiving physical rehabilitation treatment.  With this knowledge, the student will be able to adapt their treatment plan accordingly in order to intervene in a safe and effective manner.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">9:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.24</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Catherine Roy</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course focuses on vascular, cardio-vascular and respiratory problems and their impact on the client's rehabilitation. With this knowledge, the student will be able to adapt their treatment plan accordingly in order to intervene in a safe and effective manner.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">9:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.24</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-552-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Geriatrics</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vanessa Gangai</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn about the clinical presentations of the geriatric clientele in order to be able to conduct data collection from these clients and to develop and implement a treatment plan for these clients. This course will be based on lectures detailing the theory and video presentations of the special conditions and situations of this unique clientele as well as interactive labs to give students the opportunity to problem solve scenarios and develop strategies for working with real-world problems. Students are expected to be actively engaged in discussion, group work, and problem-solving while interacting with each other. Instructional strategies used will include theory lecture, class discussions, case studies, videos, peer feedback and group work.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section will be offered partially on-line. Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">9:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">Off Campus Location</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Vanessa Gangai</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn about the clinical presentations of the geriatric clientele in order to be able to conduct data collection from these clients and to develop and implement a treatment plan for these clients.
