Students registering for this section are expected to have individual access to the internet.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">9:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">Off Campus Location</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-561-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Therapeutic Relations</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Sharon Patricia Clegg</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will learn to assess verbal/non-verbal communication and emotional cues from a client. In addition, students will learn to recognize the signs of a client having difficulty coping with their given situation. Topics to be covered include; Anxiety, Depression, Grief and Loss, PTSD, OCD, Bipolar, Schizophrenia, Suicide and the Autism spectrum. We will include a perspective of cultural safety. This will enable the students to provide a safe environment for clients in the LGBTTQQIAAP community. This safe environment will extend to our First Nations communities. Students will identify the impact these topics have on a clients ability to participate in the physical rehabilitation process and will then learn to adapt their behaviours in order to encourage inclusion and cooperation of the client. There will be an opportunity to participate in Interprofessional activities, role-playing and motivational interviewing.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-562-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Special Topics in Physiotherapy Technology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Krista Gem Bulow</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The special topics course is designed to expose students to a varied collection of knowledge, expertise and experiences related to the field of physiotherapy technology. As students will be entering the workforce shortly, the class encourages independence in work and also focuses on life after graduation including postgraduate education requirements and job searching.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.14</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-591-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Clinical Education II</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-144-A, Michle Sajous-Theagne, Sabine Choltus, Vanessa Beaumont</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Clinical Education II is similar to the Clinical Education I as it will afford students the opportunity to continue to work with clients in two different work settings: orthopaedics and long term care. Student will offer professional services to clients under the supervision of a teacher from the Physiotherapy Technology Department. Expectations will be greater in terms of student involvement in the management of client care. Students are expected to be more independent, take a leadership role, and manage a greater client caseload.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section will be offered partially on-line. The more that one knows about their car, the better s/he treats it. The same holds true for the human body. In this course, students will learn the basic knowledge about how the human body works. Using the scientific method, students will problem solve how to prevent/minimize injuries and maintain good health during activities that are meaningful and important to them, now and in the future.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.38</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.38</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-P11-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to the Profession</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Alison Glinas</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will be introduced to the profession of physiotherapy technologist. They will learn how it differs from being a Physical Therapist/Physiotherapist and how it is similar. Instructional activities will help expose students to the working reality of the profession; the legal and ethical aspects of the practice of physiotherapy in Quebec and the basics of our healthcare system.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">12:30 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.24</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Alison Glinas</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will be introduced to the profession of physiotherapy technologist. They will learn how it differs from being a Physical Therapist/Physiotherapist and how it is similar. Instructional activities will help expose students to the working reality of the profession; the legal and ethical aspects of the practice of physiotherapy in Quebec and the basics of our healthcare system.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.24</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Alison Glinas</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students will be introduced to the profession of physiotherapy technologist. They will learn how it differs from being a Physical Therapist/Physiotherapist and how it is similar. Instructional activities will help expose students to the working reality of the profession; the legal and ethical aspects of the practice of physiotherapy in Quebec and the basics of our healthcare system.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.24</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">144-P12-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Anatomy I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">3 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Erika Hasler</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The major goals of this course are to locate the bones and joints of the lumbar spine and lower extremity, including the different bony landmarks, ligaments, aponeurosis, and bursa, as well as locate the muscles, peripheral nerves and blood supply of the lower quadrant. Students will identify, palpate and explain the function of the structures using proper anatomical and rehabilitation terms, including joint stability in relation to surrounding connective tissues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 11:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.18</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Erika Hasler</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The major goals of this course are to locate the bones and joints of the lumbar spine and lower extremity, including the different bony landmarks, ligaments, aponeurosis, and bursa, as well as locate the muscles, peripheral nerves and blood supply of the lower quadrant. It focuses on the stresses and strains on the federal structure stemming from the often conflicting needs and demands of people with strong regional identities.  The course also examines the functioning of parliamentary government in terms of meeting the expectations of citizens and evaluates the democratic nature of political parties, interest groups, and the voting system.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Law, Society and Justice</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.12</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Cynthia J. Martin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is a study of politics among the nation-states in the world. It looks at the role of international organizations, such as the United Nations, NATO, OECD, as well as non-governmental organizations, and the emerging civil society in dealing with conflict and promoting cooperation. Particular attention will be given to the impact of globalization, in terms of both positive and negative effects, and to the growing opposition movements.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section is compatible and available for International Business Studies and North South Studies</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - The course explores the impact that these changes had on the art and technique of the time and, wherever possible, students do related to hands-on projects from cyanotypes and making pinhole cameras to processing silver-based analogue materials. The goal is to appreciate the breadth of photography and see parallels and references that are often found in the work of contemporary photographers.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.14</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.18-5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Peter Berra</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Photo Technologies is a theoretical and practical survey of the history of photography looking at its various processes and technological evolutions. Students will work with both still and video editing. In this course, students will retouch and enhance images produced in Photo Studio 3 and Photo Location 1. They will also print, allowing them to evaluate their work in hard copy and better appreciate the intricate balance associated with the photographic process. Students will also be introduced to video editing, learning how to sequence, colour balance along with integrating sound. Software currently reviewed and covered in this course: Adobe Lightroom, Photoshop, and Premiere Pro.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.18-5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:30 PM - 5:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">1G.18-5</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">570-354-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Photo Location I</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kate Hutchinson</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course introduces students to the fundamentals of location photography including strategies to manage available light and to blend portable flash with ambient sources. The focus of the course will be to develop the students understanding of the expressive and communicative ability of the body. Exercises and explorations in the study of the movement elements of balance, space, time, will focus on developing body and spatial awareness as well as begin to physically condition the body for performance. (1.5 hours/week) Dance: Students will develop an understanding of space, energy, tempo and intensity. (1.5 hours/week) Sword Fighting: Focusing on the fundamental skills of generic sword techniques, this course will include basic fight choreographies, an introduction to sword fighting terminology for the theatre as well as a brief look at the history of the evolution of the sword. (2 hours/week)</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.16</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Elissa Bernstein, Kimberley Barfuss</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Stage movement: This course is an introduction to the kinesthetic skills required by actors for performance. An emphasis will be placed on monologues for auditions.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-357-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">History and Literature 3</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Stephane Zarov</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">A survey of European theatre from the Italian Renaissance to the English Restoration via French Neo-classicism and the Spanish Golden Age. The architecture of the theatres and lives of the actors. Introduction to Classical Sanskrit Drama. Works by Kalidasa, Machiavelli, Calderon, Molire, Racine, Middleton and Goldoni.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3F.45</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-365-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Make-up, Rehearsal and Performance 1</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-561-A, George Tucci, Jonathan Monro</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Studio production: This course will enable the student to apply his/her skills in auditioning for, rehearsing and performing a role in a full-length play. The play will be presented in a four-night run to a public audience. Out-of-class rehearsal is required.  Make-up: Students will learn to identify the material required for the different types of make-up, and learn to disguise or accentuate facial characteristics depending on the character being played.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">THEATRE</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 7:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">4:30 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">THEATRE</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-561-A, George Tucci, Matt Holland</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Studio production: This course will enable the student to apply his/her skills in auditioning for, rehearsing and performing a role in a full-length play. text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-501-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Movement for Actors 5</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Elissa Bernstein, Kimberley Barfuss</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Stage movement: This course will continue to develop the students understanding of the body as an instrument for theatrical creativity and interpretation. Designed to further reinforce the physical tools already acquired by the student actor this course intends to continue the integration of these techniques into creative dramatic situations as well as further explore the actor's physicality in relation to character and stage blocking. Dance: The student's movement vocabulary will be expanded to encompass a wider range of dance techniques and styles. Stage combat: Students will learn to merge the technical skills of stage combat with the artistic process of the actor through exploring hand-to-hand stage combat techniques used in creating moments of violence for both stage and film.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">9:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.16</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.3</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-513-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Improvisation 5</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Arianna Bardesono</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, students apply all of their improvisation skills to the collective creation or the devising of a piece of theatre based on a theme or topic that they explore and research in depth. They also work on developing narrative skills and improvising characters and monologues.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.2</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-523-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Voice and Speech 5</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jonathan Monro</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students will assimilate all previous vocal training into comprehensive exercise routines for personal use. They will develop creative control of emotion and thought in the context of voice, structure, hierarchy, inflection, impulse, preoccupation and implicit movement. The ultimate goal is to extend the expressive and interpretive vocabulary within the parameters of the natural voice. Finally, students will prepare a range of performance materials for competent, professional presentation.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-524-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Singing 1</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jonathan Monro</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Students will gain skill in solo and choral singing  melody and harmony, intonation and rhythm. They will assimilate advanced methods of warming up, exercising and extending the singing voice, including exercises in register balancing, range, style, connections and releases, reinvestment, focus, and contact point. Students will experience the interpretive potential of the singing voice through preparing solo and ensemble songs from the musical theatre, folk, operetta and chorale repertoire.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-534-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Acting 5 - Rehearsal</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Leslie Baker, Stefanie L Buxton</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">In this course, the focus is research, readings and text analysis in preparation for playing a role in the 1st and 2nd Major productions. Working with the director, students will engage in character and dialect work (if required), as well as preliminary blocking.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-535-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Acting Before the Camera 1</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Stefanie L Buxton</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Fundamentals of on-camera acting will be covered, including camera basics, shots, framing, and on-set protocol, then moving into reading and audition technique, and basic scene work. Emotional connection and preparation will also be introduced. This section will help the emerging actor step up to the challenges of film acting through daily improvisation, acting and feedback.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.1</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-557-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">History and Literature 5</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Leah Esau</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">1900 brings into play a variety of distinct theatrical styles and purposes against the background of middle class and social realism. This course will examine the development of the modern in a wide variety of theatrical texts and production styles, culminating in the theatre of the absurd. The key here is theatre as an aesthetic form, as a political force and as an expression of the age.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-565-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Rehearsal and Performance 1</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">TBA-561-D, Stefanie L Buxton</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">Major stage productions (2 and 3): Two full-length plays, supported by full production elements, taken from audition, through rehearsal, to a two-week run in front of a public audience. While gaining exposure to two directorial approaches, the student will integrate all the skills acquired to this point in order to present a clear, consistent and believable character.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">THEATRE</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">THEATRE</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">THEATRE</td><td data-label="Type">Tutorial</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">3:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3A.13</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">561-578-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Career Management</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Kimberley Barfuss</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">An introduction to the business of being a professional actor, students will be introduced to a variety of career management topics that will enable them to apply strategies for looking for work and managing their careers. Areas of discussion will focus on photos, resumes, agents, unions (CAEA, ACTRA, UDA), the business of auditioning, theatre vs. film industry, employment research, self-producing, grant writing, taxes/finances, working in other markets (i.e. TO, Vancouver, LA, NY) and other career options in the arts. Guest lecturers will include; Casting agents, Artistic Directors, Actors, Comedians, Playwrights, Production people, etc</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.1</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Psychology</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">350-101-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">General Psychology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">29 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Rajesh Malik</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the first course in the discipline for most students and a requirement for all students in the Social Science program. It is also necessary for admission to most university psychology programs. The course is designed  to acquaint students with the principles and methods of psychology and to expose them to the various areas encompassed by the field.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Law, Society and Justice</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">1:00 PM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Rajesh Malik</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the first course in the discipline for most students and a requirement for all students in the Social Science program. Emphasis is placed on the changes that occur in both physical and psychological attitudes during childhood. Discussions also focus on basic concepts and theories related to child development. In addition, developmental processes in adolescence, adulthood, and old age are considered.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Psychology</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.8</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joelle Dayan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course outlines the development of the child and how he/she is influenced by heredity, environment, family, school and social experiences. In addition, developmental processes in adolescence, adulthood, and old age are considered.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Child Studies</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.8</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">350-211-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Abnormal Psychology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">4 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Robin Joseph Gagnon</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course attempts to explain the origins and treatment of several types of mental disorders from a variety of perspectives, among them the psychoanalytic, behavioural and biological perspectives. Topics include motivation, aptitude testing, opinion and market research, advertising, compensation systems, organizational behaviour, and the role of the individual in the work place.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section is compatible and available for International Business Studies.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 2:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.8</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Stephane Gaskin</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The emphasis of this course is on the practical, non-clinical application of psychological principles. Basic concepts are covered and related to applications in business and industry. Topics include motivation, aptitude testing, opinion and market research, advertising, compensation systems, organizational behaviour, and the role of the individual in the work place.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">This section is compatible and available for International Business Studies.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:30 AM - 11:30 AM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.8</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">350-323-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Applications of Psychology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">2 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Brain and Behavior</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joelle Dayan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">At the end of this course the student will be able to understand and recognize the research methods used in the study of biological psychology. They will also be able to understand, identify, explain, and explore the major findings of biological psychology. Students will learn about various neurological disorders, their causes and their possible treatments. They will be able to apply the concepts of biological psychology to real life situations and learn how to navigate through databases, references, and write a paper analyzing several journal articles.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Psychology</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Friday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section Title</label><div class="col-md-10">Brain and Behavior</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Joelle Dayan</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">At the end of this course the student will be able to understand and recognize the research methods used in the study of biological psychology. 4:30 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5E.8</td><td data-label="Type">Intensive</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Quantitative Methods</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">360-125-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Science: History and Methodology</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teachers</label><div class="col-md-10">Gesche Peters, Jaime Sandoval</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course studies the conception of scientific knowledge through a close examination of the key ideas and findings of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo, Descartes, Newton and Darwin, and their contemporary practitioners of science. Students examine the transition from a qualitative to a mathematical and quantitative conception of the universe. The development of the concepts of scientific law and scientific explanation, and the formulations of the scientific method, and of systematic experimentation as tools of the production of knowledge will be studied.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Liberal Arts</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">2:30 PM - 4:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">3E.13</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">8:00 AM - 10:00 AM</td><td data-label="Room">7A.9</td><td data-label="Type">Lab</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">360-300-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Quantitative Methods</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">31 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00002</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Laurence Nixon</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the second of the three (3) methodology courses. It builds on the introduction to social science research covered in Research Methods. This course teaches the student to apply statistical tools to the interpretation of data related to contexts of study in the field of social science. The focus of the course is on the analysis of quantitative data as part of the scientific approach. Areas examined are identification of variables, presentation of data, analysis of data using various forms of measurement, determining the nature and link between variables, and estimating the parameters of a given population based on the corresponding statistics obtained from a sample.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Child Studies</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">10:00 AM - 12:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">5B.11</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00003</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Anna De Aguayo</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the second of the three (3) methodology courses. This course teaches the student to apply statistical tools to the interpretation of data related to contexts of study in the field of social science. The focus of the course is on the analysis of quantitative data as part of the scientific approach. Areas examined are identification of variables, presentation of data, analysis of data using various forms of measurement, determining the nature and link between variables, and estimating the parameters of a given population based on the corresponding statistics obtained from a sample.</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">Psychology</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Monday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Wednesday</td><td data-label="Time">4:00 PM - 6:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00019</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Jan Alexandros Arvanitakis</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This is the second of the three (3) methodology courses. Students registering for this section CAN TAKE IT SEPARATELY OR AS A PAIR WITH 330-325-DW 12001.</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">12:00 PM - 2:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">4H.23</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">360-320-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Preparing for Field Trip</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">1 section</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Gisela Frias</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">The purpose of this course is to allow students to carry out the specific and immediate preparation for the success of the forthcoming field trip to Nicaragua. It comprises an academic component (developing an in-depth knowledge of Nicaragua) and a psychological and group dynamics component (learning to deal with culture shock, health problems and group conflict).</div></li><!-- description --><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Comment</label><div class="col-md-10">North South Studies</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Course<br> Drop Date</label><div class="col-md-10">Monday, September 19, 2022</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Schedule</label><div class="col-md-10 schedule"><table class="schedule-details"><tr><td data-label="Day">Tuesday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr><tr><td data-label="Day">Thursday</td><td data-label="Time">11:30 AM - 1:00 PM</td><td data-label="Room">2P.02</td><td data-label="Type">Class</td></tr></table><!-- .schedule-details --></div></li><!-- schedule --></ul><!-- .section-details --></div></div><!-- .course-list-table --><h2>Radiation Oncology</h2><div class="course-list-table"><div class="course-wrap"><div class="course-number-title clearfix"><div class="info-container row" style="overflow:hidden; text-align:right;"><div class="cnumber btn btn-default col-md-2">142-101-DW</div> <div class="ctitle col-md-8" style="text-align:left;">Introduction to the Profession</div>  <span class="csection btn btn-sm col-md-2" style="display:inline-block;">4 sections</span></div><span class="expand-row"></span></div><ul class="section-details clearfix"><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Section</label><div class="col-md-10"><strong>00001</strong></div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Teacher</label><div class="col-md-10">Anabel Gratton</div></li><li class="row"><label class="col-md-2">Description</label><div class="col-md-10 description">This course is designed to introduce aspects of the Radiation Oncology discipline at an elementary level. The student will practice patient care and effective teamwork in carrying out daily tasks with colleagues. The student will participate, for planning purposes, in the production and use of accessories for treatment, (setup, imaging verification, post procedural responsibilities, and dosimetry). The student will also participate in the setup, imaging verification, and the administration of a treatment.
